alert.note: Alert for Big Island East; Big Island North; Lanai Leeward; Maui Leeward West (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 12 at 3:19AM HST until January 13 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI...NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI...AND WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF MAUI AND LANAI AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .An extra-large northwest (330 degrees) swell will be slow to diminish today, then shift to the north (350 degrees) tonight and Friday as it gradually eases. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For Maui and Lanai, surf 12 to 16 feet. For Big Island, surf of 15 to 20 feet. * WHERE...West facing shores of Maui and Lanai, and north facing shores of Big Island. Surf will gradually diminish tonight. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Friday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.

area.areaDesc: Big Island East; Big Island North; Lanai Leeward; Maui Leeward West
